segments.text: Look at that—the sink's faucet is on full blast, water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I didn't expect to see such a flood in a tidy kitchen like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's polishing her plate, foot in the puddle, totally zoned out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And whoa, the boy's balancing on that wobbly stool for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's got cookies in hand, plate as a shield—clever kid.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's reaching up, all eager and cooperative in their little scheme.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's surprising how the garden outside stays serene amid this indoor frenzy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The curtains are tied back, letting in light on all this unnoticed action.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water streaming down the cabinets— that's going to be a cleanup nightmare.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression is so calm; she must be in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar's label is clear, full of temptation for the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm amazed no one's heard the water or the stool creaking yet.
segments.speaker: PAR
